column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=Reagents.
#Text=CuCl2 (Alfa Aesar, 99.9 %), MnCl2 (Alfa Aesar, 99.9 %), ZnCl2 (Alfa Aesar, 99.95 %), HIO3 (Alfa Aesar, 99.5 %), HNO3 (BDH, 67 %) were used as starting materials.
#Text=Synthesis. α-Cu(IO3)2.
#Text=Polycrystalline α-Cu(IO3)2 was syn-thesized by heating Cu(IO3)2. 2/3H2O at 300 °C for 8 hours (Figure S1).
#Text=For Cu(IO3)2.2/3H2O, anhydrous CuCl2 (2.5 mmol) was dissolved in HNO3 (1M, 25 mL) and then an aqueous solution of HIO3 (5 mmol, 10 mL) was added.
#Text=The mixture was stirred at 80 °C for 1 h.
#Text=Greenish polycrystal-line Cu(IO3)2.2/3H2O was isolated from the mother-liquor after 24 h by filtration, washed with deionized water and dried in air (yield of α-Cu(IO3)2 , 92 %; based on Cu).
#Text=Mn(IO3)2.
#Text=Polycrystalline Mn(IO3)2 was synthesized by the reaction of MnCl2 and HIO3 at 80 °C and ambient pressure.
#Text=MnCl2 (2.5 mmol) was dissolved in HNO3 (1 M, 25 mL).
#Text=An aqueous solution of HIO3 (5 mmol, 10 mL) was added and the mixture was stirred at 80 °C for 1 h.
#Text=A pale pink solid was isolated from the reaction mixture by filtration and washed with deionized water.
#Text=The solid was dried in air for 1 week to give anhydrous polycrystalline Mn(IO3)2 (yield of Mn(IO3)2 , 86 %; based on Mn) (Figure S2).
#Text=Zn(IO3)2.
#Text=ZnCl2 (2.5 mmol) was dissolved in HNO3 (1 M, 25 mL).
#Text=An aqueous solution of HIO3 (5 mmol, 10 mL) was added and the mixture was stirred at 80 °C for 1 h to give a colorless solution.
#Text=Colorless solid of polycrystalline Zn(IO3)2 precipitated from the solution after 3 days and was collected by filtration and dried in air (yield of Zn(IO3)2, 65 %; based on Zn) (Figure S3).
